title: Program Detail - Find a Program
raw_text:
This website uses resources that are being blocked by your network. Contact your network administrator for more information.
Skip to main content
Find a Program
Program Detail
Communication Leadership Program (Master of Communication)
Apply Now >>
Basic Information
Degree Information
Degree Offered:
MASTER OF COMMUNICATION
CIP Code:
09.0101
Campus: Seattle
Admission Requirements and Contact Information
Our annual admissions process consists of multiple rounds. Please see detailed deadline and notification information for each round on our
website
. We encourage all applicants to watch or attend an
Admissions Event
before beginning your application
Contact Information
Heather N. Werckle, Assistant Director of Academic Services
Program Website
+1 206-543-6745
commlead@uw.edu
Requirements and Prerequisites
Applicants must meet all
UW Graduate School minimum admissions requirements
to be eligible for consideration.
GRE Requirements
GRE Requirement:
Not Considered
. GRE scores are not required and, if submitted, will not be considered during the admissions decision process.
Additional Instructions
Our application is fully online. Please do not mail materials to the department as they will not be considered.
Recommendation Instructions
We require a minimum of two recommendations, though you may submit more. We encourage a diversity of recommenders – those who can reflect on your academic, professional, and/or volunteer experience. These might be professors, employers, internship supervisors, advisors, or mentors.
Use the “Recommendations” link on the left hand side bar to designate your recommenders.
Non-Native English Speaker Information
Graduate School requirement:
English language proficiency (ELP) is required for graduate study at the University of Washington. Therefore, every applicant whose native language is not English must demonstrate English language proficiency as outlined in
Graduate School Policy 3.2
.
International Student Information
Applicants who will need a visa should reference the
International Applicant Information page
. If admitted to the program, international students requesting an F1 or J1 visa will be required to provide
financial ability documentation
to the UW Graduate School.
No departmental funding available.
Program Deadlines
Autumn 2026 - Domestic:
Open Date:
11/01/2025
Deadline Date:
01/30/2026
Autumn 2026 - International:
Open Date:
11/01/2025
Deadline Date:
01/30/2026
Application Materials
Personal Statement
Portfolio
2 Recommendation(s)
Resume
Menu

application_requirements.academic_background: Applicants must meet all UW Graduate School minimum admissions requirements.
application_requirements.gre: GRE scores are not required and, if submitted, will not be considered during the admissions decision process.
application_requirements.english_tests: English language proficiency (ELP) is required for graduate study at the University of Washington.
application_requirements.summary: Applicants must meet all UW Graduate School minimum admissions requirements. GRE scores are not required. English language proficiency is required for non-native speakers. A minimum of two recommendations is required, and additional materials include a personal statement, portfolio, and resume.
